lead_paragraph: Arthur Beale, one of the world’s leading authorities on Degas, now believes that a plaster of “Little Dancer,” discovered in 2004, was created during Degas’s lifetime.

headline.print_headline: Did Degas Make This Plaster? A Leading Expert Now Says Yes
headline.main: Did Degas Make This Plaster? An Expert Now Says Yes

snippet: Arthur Beale, one of the world’s leading authorities on Degas, now believes that a plaster of “Little Dancer,” discovered in 2004, was created during Degas’s lifetime....
abstract: Arthur Beale, former conservation and collections management chairman at Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, endorses controversial theory by art historian Gregory Hedberg that plaster cast similar to Degas sculpture known as Little Dancer was made during Degas's lifetime; French Institute Alliance Francaise attributes plaster to Degas in current exhibition, which coincides with release of Hedberg's book Degas' Little Dancer Aged Fourteen.
